results_summary: The study found that inulin combined with Clostridium butyricum (7% CB + 1% inulin) significantly improved glucose tolerance, reduced cholesterol and triglyceride levels, and positively altered gut microbiota composition in obese mice. The combination was more effective than CB alone.
population_specificity: Obese mice fed a high-fat diet.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if inulin could reshape the gut microbiota of colitis patients and alleviate colitis symptoms in a mouse model.
results_summary: Inulin altered the gut microbiota, promoting growth of Faecalibacterium and Blautia, and improved colitis symptoms in mice by regulating inflammatory cytokines, enhancing the intestinal barrier, and restoring colonic tissue structure.
population_specificity: Colitis patients (feces used for fermentation) and DSS-induced colitis mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of inulin supplementation on migraine headache characteristics, quality of life, and mental health symptoms in women with migraines.
results_summary: Inulin supplementation significantly reduced migraine severity, duration, frequency, and HIT-6 scores, and improved mental health symptoms (depression, anxiety, stress), but did not significantly affect quality of life scores compared to placebo.
population_specificity: Women aged 20 to 50 years with migraines.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of inulin on the rheological, texture, and structural properties of collagen-based oleogels and its fat substitution ability in low-fat beef patties.
results_summary: Inulin improved the stability and oil-binding ability of oleogels, reduced cooking loss in beef patties, and enabled a 50% fat substitution level with minimal differences from pure adipose tissue, enhancing storage stability and reducing saturated fatty acids.
population_specificity: Collagen-based oleogels and low-fat beef patties (in vitro/food model study).
effective_dosage: Ratio of collagen to inulin complex was 1:5; 50% olive oil addition.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess whether chicory inulin-type fructans (ITFs) supplementation supports weight management by analyzing its effects on body weight, BMI, fat mass, waist circumference, and body fat percentage.
results_summary: The study found that chicory ITF significantly reduced body weight, BMI, fat mass, and waist circumference, with a modest reduction in body fat percentage for interventions longer than 8 weeks. The effects were consistent across different health statuses, but dose, duration, and ITF type did not significantly influence the outcomes.
population_specificity: Individuals with varying health statuses (specific conditions not detailed in the abstract).
study_duration: Varied, with significant effects observed for interventions >8 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether inulin could modulate CNS autoimmunity and ameliorate symptoms in a mouse model of multiple sclerosis (EAE) by altering gut microbiota and metabolites.
results_summary: Oral inulin reduced EAE severity in mice, decreased inflammatory cell infiltration and demyelination, lowered Th17 cell proportions, and reduced pro-inflammatory cytokines (IL-17, IL-6, TNF-α). These effects were linked to gut microbiota changes (increased Lactobacillus and Dubosiella, decreased g_Prevotellaceae_NK3B31_group) and elevated butyric acid levels.
population_specificity: Mice with experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis (EAE), a model of multiple sclerosis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the appropriateness of inulin supplementation for delaying CKD outcomes and managing comorbidities in patients with chronic kidney disease.
results_summary: The panel consensus found inulin supplementation appropriate for delaying CKD outcomes and managing comorbidities, based on clinical experience and scientific evidence.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic kidney disease (CKD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of an inulin-type fructan (AMP) extracted from Atractylodis Macrocephalae Rhizoma on psoriasis-like skin lesions and its underlying mechanisms.
results_summary: AMP improved psoriasis-like skin lesions in animal studies and downregulated inflammatory gene expression (Il-17a, Il-23, Il-22, Il-6, Il-12, Tnf-α). Cellular experiments showed AMP inhibited hyperproliferation and overexpression of inflammatory genes in keratinocytes, potentially via the PI3K/AKT/mTOR pathway.
population_specificity: Animal models (imiquimod-induced psoriasis-like lesions) and human immortal keratinocyte cells (HaCaT).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether dietary inulin could improve intestinal flora, inflammation, and metabolic disturbances in obese women with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS).
results_summary: Inulin improved sex hormone disorders, reduced BMI and WHR levels, lowered inflammatory markers (TNF-α, IL-1β, IL-6, MCP-1), and modulated gut microbiota by increasing beneficial bacteria (Actinobacteria, Fusobacteria, Lachnospira, Bifidobacterium) while reducing harmful ones (Proteobacteria, Sutterella, Enterobacter).
population_specificity: Obese women with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether heat-killed Bifidobacterium longum BBMN68 (MN68) and inulin (IN) have an anti-obesity effect, particularly in combination.
results_summary: The combination of heat-killed MN68 and inulin showed enhanced effects in preventing weight gain, reducing fat accumulation, and regulating lipid metabolism compared to either treatment alone. It also significantly altered gut microbiota composition and increased SCFA levels.
population_specificity: Wistar rats fed a high-fat diet.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of different concentrations of inulin on ram sperm quality parameters, SOD activity, and MDA production after freezing and thawing.
results_summary: Inulin at 28 mM significantly improved total motility, viability, DNA integrity, and membrane integrity of ram sperm while reducing MDA levels and increasing SOD activity compared to other concentrations and the control.
population_specificity: Ram sperm samples from four healthy rams.
effective_dosage: 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, and 28 mM inulin in a Tris-base extender.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if the combined use of inulin, chitosan, and Lactiplantibacillus plantarum LPP95 could enhance the quality of low-salt tuber mustard pickles during fermentation.
results_summary: The study found that inulin, combined with chitosan and L. plantarum LPP95, improved pickle quality by increasing crispness, maintaining low nitrate content, altering amino acid profiles, and producing unique volatile flavor compounds. It also promoted microbial diversity and increased the abundance of Lactiplantibacillus.
population_specificity: Low-salt tuber mustard pickles (fermentation system)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of inulin, alone and in combination with Bacillus coagulans lactospore, on gut microbial activity and composition using the M-SHIME® model.
results_summary: Inulin supplementation increased health-promoting short-chain fatty acids (acetate and butyrate) and boosted the abundance of beneficial saccharolytic bacteria like Megamonas, Bifidobacterium, and Faecalibacterium. Synbiotic combinations showed greater effects than inulin or probiotic alone, with benefits more pronounced after repeated administration.
population_specificity: Simulated human intestinal microbial ecosystem (M-SHIME® model).
effective_dosage: Low and high doses of synbiotic combination (specific amounts not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to elucidate the catalytic mechanism of GH91 inulin fructotransferase (IFTase) in the biodegradation of inulin for potential dietary interventions in metabolic syndrome.
results_summary: The study identified conserved noncatalytic binding regions and a catalytic center with residue E205, revealing a switching scaffold (D194 and Q217) that stabilizes substrate transitions, enabling consecutive chain cutting and product release in IFTase. These findings expand understanding of enzyme-substrate interactions and inform rational enzyme design for fructan biotransformation.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro study using IFTase from Arthrobacter aurescens SK 8.001).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether inulin supplementation improved gut microbiota diversity and microbial functional pathways in children with obesity.
results_summary: Inulin supplementation significantly increased gut bacterial diversity, enhanced beneficial bacteria like Bifidobacterium and butyrate-producing species, and modulated functional pathways related to proteasome and riboflavin metabolism, correlating with improved clinical and metabolic outcomes.
population_specificity: Children aged 7-15 with obesity (BMI above median + 2SDs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of B. stercoris PE treatment on in vitro inhibition of starch-metabolizing enzymes and evaluate its effects on glucose uptake and starch synthesis gene expression.
results_summary: B. stercoris PE treatment enhanced grain quality by improving starch ultrastructure, inhibiting starch-metabolizing enzymes (α-amylase and α-glucosidase), and modulating starch synthesis and glucose transporter gene expression, suggesting potential benefits for managing type II diabetes.
population_specificity: In vitro study involving traditional and commercial rice varieties of South India and 3T3-L1 adipocytes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the beneficial and potentially harmful effects of inulin supplementation in colorectal cancer prevention and treatment enhancement.
results_summary: The study found limited clinical evidence supporting inulin's efficacy in preventing colorectal cancer, despite its fermentation into beneficial short-chain fatty acids. Recent data also suggest improper inulin consumption may harm gastrointestinal health in certain cases.
population_specificity: Western population consuming inulin through processed food and dietary supplements.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a functional food product supplemented with inulin, cocoa, and Moringa could serve as an adjuvant in treating constipation in Parkinson's disease patients.
results_summary: Inulin supplementation significantly increased soluble and insoluble fiber content, improved antioxidant capacity, and enhanced folate intake. Sensory evaluation showed high preference (78% purchase intention) for inulin and inulin + cocoa products.
population_specificity: People suffering from Parkinson's disease with constipation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the effect of inulin, alone and combined with rifaximin, on pulmonary metastasis of colon cancer in a mouse model.
results_summary: Inulin alone did not improve pulmonary metastasis, but combined with rifaximin, it significantly prolonged survival, inhibited metastasis, altered gut microbiota, reduced harmful bile acids, and modulated gene expression related to cancer progression.
population_specificity: CT26-injected mice with pulmonary metastatic colon cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combining high-dose vitamin D3 and inulin could improve gut and airway microbiota composition in adults with cystic fibrosis.
results_summary: Participants receiving vitamin D3 plus inulin showed greater microbiome changes in both intestinal and airway microbiota compared to other groups, suggesting potential benefits in mitigating dysbiosis. The combination was well tolerated over 12 weeks.
population_specificity: Adults with cystic fibrosis (n=40).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to highlight the role of inulin in immunomodulatory responses, the development of inulin-based hybrid biopolymers, and its potential in cancer immunotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that inulin activates immune cells and promotes cytokine secretion, enhancing host defenses against cancer. It also discussed chemical modifications of inulin for potential use in cancer treatment.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion, no specific population studied).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the combined effects of pomegranate juice and inulin on gut microbiota composition and associated metabolites in overweight/obese individuals.
results_summary: PJ+inulin significantly altered gut microbiota composition and increased the production of microbiota-associated short-chain fatty acids and polyphenol metabolites, though no significant changes were observed in anthropometric or blood biochemical indicators. The combined treatment had a more profound impact on gut microbiota than PJ alone.
population_specificity: Overweight/obese individuals (BMI 25-35 kg/m²).
effective_dosage: 200 mL/day of PJ supplemented with inulin (inulin dosage not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of inulin on gut microbiome composition, metabolite production, and colon tissue barrier integrity using a combined in vitro and ex vivo model.
results_summary: Inulin promoted the growth of beneficial bacteria (Anaerostipes, Bifidobacterium, Blautia, Collinsella) and increased butyrate production. It also improved colon tissue barrier integrity and reduced pro-inflammatory cytokine release.
population_specificity: Human gut microbiome (fecal pool from 6 healthy donors) and colon tissue explants (n = 3 donors).
study_duration: 24 hours for both microbiome culture and tissue exposure.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how atmospheric pressure plasma jet (APPJ) discharge power affects the structural and functional properties of pea protein-inulin glycosylation conjugates, particularly solubility and emulsifying ability.
results_summary: The study found that APPJ treatment at 600 W improved the solubility of the glycosylation conjugate by 14.85% and emulsifying stability by 21.95% compared to glycosylation alone, without altering the primary structure of pea protein.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study on pea protein-inulin conjugates).
effective_dosage: Not specified (discharge power of 600 W used for APPJ treatment).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether inulin's effects on atherosclerosis are mediated by changes in intestinal flora and metabolites, and to clarify the underlying mechanisms.
results_summary: Inulin reduced atherosclerotic plaque area, serum LPS levels, aortic inflammation, and improved lipid profiles (TC, TG, LDL-C) in high-fat diet-fed ApoE-/- mice. It also partially reversed hyperlipidemia-induced changes in gut microbiota (e.g., Prevotella) and metabolites (e.g., L-arginine).
population_specificity: ApoE-deficient (ApoE-/-) mice fed a high-fat diet.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to study the gut-muscle axis effects of inulin supplementation in obese children, focusing on muscle biomarkers and anti-inflammatory mechanisms.
results_summary: Inulin supplementation increased IL-15 and creatinine/cystatin C ratio, indicating improved muscle biomarkers. Bifidobacterium metabolites from inulin digestion showed anti-inflammatory effects, reducing pro-inflammatory cytokines and promoting muscle production.
population_specificity: Obese children aged 7-15 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if inulin supplementation could mitigate anxiety-related behavior and hepatic oxidative stress caused by high-fat diet-induced obesity in female rats.
results_summary: Inulin reduced adiposity and hepatic oxidative stress but had mixed effects on behavior, showing anxiolytic effects in some tests while impairing learning and memory in others.
population_specificity: Female Wistar rats with high-fat diet-induced obesity.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of inulin on diabetes-related chronic inflammation and kidney injury in a mouse model of type 2 diabetes.
results_summary: Inulin administration reduced fasting blood glucose, LDL-C, BUN, and creatinine levels, improved kidney injury, lowered inflammatory markers, increased SCFA concentrations, and decreased AGEs. It also influenced metabolic pathways linked to inflammation and kidney damage.
population_specificity: ICR mice with induced type 2 diabetes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether inulin reduces intestinal colonization by multidrug-resistant E. coli and to explore its mechanisms of action.
results_summary: The combination of inulin and pantoprazole significantly reduced ESBL-E. coli fecal titers, with inulin alone showing delayed and limited effects. The treatment was linked to increased abundance of specific taxa, enhanced propionate production, and beta-lactamase activity, suggesting a dual mechanism of action.
population_specificity: Mice with amoxicillin-induced intestinal dysbiosis inoculated with ESBL-E. coli.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether WPI-inulin conjugates, prepared via wet heating or ultrasound methods, could improve the structural and functional properties of whey protein isolate (WPI).
results_summary: The study found that WPI-inulin conjugates exhibited improved thermal stability, emulsifying activity, emulsion stability, and antioxidant activity compared to WPI alone, with ultrasound-treated conjugates showing the highest emulsifying properties. Structural changes in the conjugates were confirmed through various analytical techniques.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of inulin on antibiotic-induced intestinal microbiota dysbiosis and compare its impact when supplemented at different stages (post-antibiotic, simultaneous, or pre-antibiotic treatment).
results_summary: Inulin supplementation mitigated antibiotic-induced dysbiosis, with pre-supplementation showing the most significant effect, followed by simultaneous supplementation, while post-supplementation had limited impact compared to spontaneous restoration.
population_specificity: C57BL/6 mice model

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether inulin could mitigate food allergy symptoms and intestinal injury in a mouse model by modulating gut microbiota.
results_summary: Inulin attenuated allergic reactions and intestinal injury in OVA-sensitized mice, increased beneficial gut bacteria (e.g., Blautia, Lachnospiraceae), and reduced harmful bacteria (e.g., Alloprevotella, Eubacterium siraeum). It also improved serum and intestinal biomarkers (IgA, IgE, DAO) linked to allergy and gut health.
population_specificity: OVA-sensitized mice (animal model).
effective_dosage: High-dose (H) and low-dose (L) inulin (specific concentrations not stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and evaluate novel nanomicelles coupling inulin with levofloxacin for targeted treatment of salmonellosis and inflammatory bowel disease by enhancing antibacterial efficacy and promoting gut microbiota balance.
results_summary: The nanomicelles effectively targeted the inflamed colon, selectively released levofloxacin, and increased beneficial bacteria (Bifidobacteria and Lactobacilli) in mice with salmonellosis, demonstrating superior anti-inflammatory effects compared to pure levofloxacin.
population_specificity: Mice with salmonellosis

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether inulin, GOS, and polyphenols stimulate the growth of Akkermansia muciniphila in the gut.
results_summary: The study found that GOS increased the relative abundance of A. muciniphila in healthy participants and enriched metabolic pathways related to carbohydrate metabolism and short-chain fatty acid release. Inulin's effects were not specifically highlighted in the abstract.
population_specificity: 451 participants (821 stool samples) from six microbiome studies, primarily healthy individuals.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate how ultrasound and varying inulin concentrations affect the structural and functional properties of soybean isolate protein-inulin complexes.
results_summary: The study found that inulin bound to soybean protein via hydrogen bonding and hydrophobic interactions, improving flexibility, solubility, emulsifying, and foaming properties, with optimal results at 20 mg/mL inulin combined with ultrasound.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study on protein complexes)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effectiveness and mechanism of AOFOS (a polysaccharide from Aspidopterys obcordata) in treating kidney stones by inhibiting calcium oxalate crystal growth.
results_summary: The study found that AOFOS was transported to the urinary system, inhibited calcium oxalate crystal accumulation, and modulated urine properties, effectively preventing kidney stone formation in rats.
population_specificity: Rats with induced kidney stones.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether dietary inulin supplementation could reduce morbidity and mortality from SARS-CoV-2 infection by modulating the gut microbiome and increasing beneficial metabolites like SCFAs and bile acids.
results_summary: Inulin supplementation reduced weight loss and improved survival rates in SARS-CoV-2-infected hamsters, with notable changes in microbiome composition and increased serum DCA levels, suggesting a protective role against the virus.
population_specificity: Syrian hamsters

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether CP-A (an inulin-type fructan) could mitigate 5-fluorouracil-induced intestinal mucositis by modulating the ERK/MLCK/MLC2 pathway, reducing inflammation, and improving gut microbiota.
results_summary: CP-A restored body weight and food intake, reversed histopathological damage, attenuated abnormal MLCK activation, improved tight junction proteins, reduced inflammatory factors, and regulated gut microbiota by increasing Lactobacillus and decreasing Shigella abundance.
population_specificity: Rats with 5-fluorouracil-induced intestinal mucositis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the protective effects and underlying mechanisms of inulin-type fructan CP-A against experimental colitis in vitro and in vivo.
results_summary: CP-A significantly reduced inflammatory markers (ROS, TNF-α, IL-6, IL-1β, IL-18) and improved intestinal barrier proteins (Claudin-1, ZO-1, occludin) in vitro, while in vivo it alleviated colitis symptoms, reduced oxidative stress, and enhanced autophagy-mediated NLRP3 inflammasome inactivation.
population_specificity: LPS-induced colonic epithelial cells (NCM460) and DSS-induced colitis mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether inulin supplements could protect against colonic fibrosis caused by radiation therapy.
results_summary: Inulin supplements increased the proliferation of bacteria producing short-chain fatty acids (SCFAs) and elevated fecal SCFA levels. In a mouse model, inulin-derived metabolites reduced colonic fibrosis and suppressed fibrosis-related gene expression.
population_specificity: Mouse model of chronic radiation enteropathy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore inulin's potential in enhancing intestinal immunity and reducing inflammation in stress-recurrent IBD.
results_summary: Inulin reduced pro-inflammatory cytokine expression (CXCL8/IL8 and TNFA) and increased MUC2 expression in intestinal epithelial cells. In vivo, inulin intake decreased serum inflammatory markers (IL-6, CALP), downregulated inflammatory cytokines (Il6), increased SCFAs, and reduced ER stress markers (CHOP, BiP), improving IBD symptoms.
population_specificity: Stress-recurrent IBD mouse model and co-culture intestinal epithelium model.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of inulin combined with Lactobacillaceae, polydextrose, and aerobic exercise on gut microbiota composition and metabolic profiles in db/db mice.
results_summary: Inulin, combined with other interventions, significantly improved hyperglycemia, glucose tolerance, insulin resistance, inflammatory response, and metabolic profiles, while favorably altering gut microbiota composition and sphingolipid/purine metabolism pathways.
population_specificity: db/db mice (a model for type 2 diabetes)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether inulin-type fructans (ITFs) could improve insulin resistance, blood lipids, anthropometric measures, and hormonal status in overweight and obese women with PCOS.
results_summary: ITF supplementation, particularly long-chain ITFs, improved waist circumference, testosterone levels, triglycerides, and menstrual regularity in women with PCOS. The high-performance inulin (HPI) group also showed reduced body mass, fasting insulin, and HOMA-IR, along with increased insulin sensitivity.
population_specificity: Overweight and obese women aged 18-40 with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS).
effective_dosage: 10 g/day of either high-performance inulin (HPI) or oligofructose-enriched inulin (OEI).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the impact of a fiber supplement containing inulin on body weight and composition in individuals with obesity and specific genetic polymorphisms.
results_summary: The study found that the fiber supplement (including inulin) significantly reduced body weight, BMI, fat mass, and visceral fat in participants, particularly in homozygous minor allele carriers. However, a high incidence of gastrointestinal side effects (74.6%) was reported in the experimental group.
population_specificity: 112 adults with obesity and at least one minor allele in FTO, LEP, LEPR, or MC4R polymorphisms.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a synbiotic composed of inulin and Pediococcus acidilactici could alleviate DSS-induced colitis in mice.
results_summary: The synbiotic attenuated weight loss, reduced disease activity, improved anti-oxidation and inflammation markers, reversed colonic damage, and lowered pro-inflammatory cytokine levels in mice with colitis.
population_specificity: Mice with DSS-induced colitis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and evaluate dual-targeted nanoparticles (CBD NPs) based on modified inulin for targeted delivery of cannabidiol (CBD) to treat ulcerative colitis (UC).
results_summary: The study found that CBD NPs effectively targeted mitochondria and colon tissue, reduced inflammation via the TLR4-NF-κB pathway, improved colonic barrier function, and restored intestinal flora balance in UC mice.
population_specificity: DSS-induced UC mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of combined inulin and resveratrol on kidney function in diabetic rats, focusing on oxidative stress and inflammation.
results_summary: The study found that inulin, especially when combined with resveratrol, improved kidney function, reduced oxidative stress, and decreased inflammation in diabetic rats, outperforming monotherapies.
population_specificity: Diabetic rats induced by streptozotocin.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether inulin could improve burn-induced muscle atrophy by regulating gut microbiota disorders in rats.
results_summary: Inulin significantly alleviated burn-induced muscle mass loss and cell apoptosis, increased beneficial gut bacteria (Firmicutes, Actinobacteria), decreased harmful bacteria (Proteobacteria), and activated the PI3K/AKT signaling pathway for protein synthesis.
population_specificity: Burn-injured rats with 30% total body surface area third-degree burns.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether dietary inulin (INU) could alleviate constipation-induced depression and anxiety-like behaviors in mice via modulation of gut microbiota and the microbiota-gut-SCFAs axis.
results_summary: INU treatment improved constipation, depression, and anxiety-like behaviors by reducing neuro-inflammation, protecting synaptic ultrastructure, enhancing gut barrier function, and reshaping gut microbiota. It also increased fecal SCFAs, which contributed to the observed benefits.
population_specificity: Male CD-1 mice with diphenoxylate-induced constipation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of inulin on body weight loss and tumor formation in mice exposed to PAHs, as well as its impact on colorectal tumor cells in vitro.
results_summary: Inulin (10 g/L) did not affect colon length or tumor formation in mice but significantly reduced body weight loss compared to the fiber-free group. In vitro, inulin's effects were not directly assessed, but PAHs decreased tumor cell viability and increased CYP1A1 and CYP1B1 expression.
population_specificity: Mice with colitis induced by 3% DSS and colorectal tumor cells (HT-29, HCT116, LS174T).
effective_dosage: 10 g/L in drinking water for mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize recent developments in inulin-based nanomaterials and nanocomposites for cancer therapy, focusing on its multifunctional roles as a synergist, signaling molecule, immunomodulator, and anticarcinogenic agent.
results_summary: The review highlights inulin's potential in cancer treatment due to its unique structure, stability, and nutritional properties, positioning it as an effective adjuvant and drug carrier. It also provides an overview of ongoing clinical trials and observational studies related to inulin-based therapy.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research and clinical trials)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of inulin as a cryoprotectant for red blood cell (RBC) cryopreservation compared to glycerol and hydroxyethyl starch.
results_summary: Inulin significantly improved thawed RBC recovery from 11.83% to 81.86%, promoted vitrification, stabilized membranes, and inhibited ice recrystallization damage, outperforming glycerol and hydroxyethyl starch. RBC properties remained normal post-cryopreservation.
population_specificity: Red blood cells (RBCs) in a laboratory setting.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the therapeutic effect of inulin-type fructan CP-A from Codonopsis pilosula on ulcerative colitis (UC) and explore its mechanism of action.
results_summary: CP-A reduced colonic injury, inflammation markers (IL-8, TNF-α), and mTOR/p70S6K pathway activation while increasing anti-inflammatory cytokines (IL-10, TGF-β) in both in vivo and in vitro models. The findings suggest CP-A alleviates UC by modulating the mTOR signaling pathway.
population_specificity: TNBS-induced UC rat model and LPS-stimulated human colonic epithelial cells (NCM460).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to characterize an inulin neoseries-type fructan (OJP-W2) from Ophiopogonis Radix and investigate its therapeutic effects on liver fibrosis.
results_summary: OJP-W2 demonstrated significant hepatoprotective effects against liver fibrosis by regulating collagen deposition, reducing inflammation, and inhibiting hepatic apoptosis through modulation of TGF-β/Smads and MAPK signaling pathways.
population_specificity: In vivo study (animal model, specific species not mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how the baseline Bacteroides/Bifidobacterium (Ba/Bi) ratio influences the gut microbiota's response to inulin and FOS fermentation, and to identify key microbiota predicting SCFA levels.
results_summary: The study found that individuals with a high Ba/Bi ratio (H group) benefited more from prebiotic intervention, showing increased microbial diversity, higher beneficial bacteria (e.g., Ruminococcus gnavus, Blautia), reduced pathogenic bacteria, and enhanced carbohydrate degradation and fatty acid synthesis. Inulin was associated with specific co-abundance response groups (CARG4) linked to SCFA production.
population_specificity: Individuals categorized into Bacteroides/Bifidobacterium high (H) and low (L) groups based on gut microbiota composition.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether inulin could mitigate PFOA-induced intestinal toxicity in mice by examining its effects on inflammation, tight junction disruption, and related signaling pathways.
results_summary: Inulin supplementation alleviated PFOA-induced colon shortening, goblet cell reduction, and inflammatory cell infiltration, while improving tight junction protein expression and modulating key signaling pathways (PI3K/AKT/mTOR, TNF, and cell cycle pathways).
population_specificity: Male mice exposed to PFOA

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combined intake of Bifidobacterium animalis subsp. lactis GCL2505 and inulin reduces abdominal fat and improves the intestinal environment.
results_summary: The study found significant reductions in visceral fat area (VFA) and total fat area, along with increased bifidobacteria levels and improved lipid markers. Regression analysis suggested that increases in bifidobacteria contributed to the decrease in VFA, likely via the SCFA-mediated pathway.
population_specificity: 120 participants in a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, parallel-group study.
effective_dosage: 1 × 10^10 CFU of GCL2505 and 2.0 g of inulin per 100 g of test beverage.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a synbiotic combination of Lactobacillus reuteri and inulin could mitigate social impairments in an ASD-like mouse model by modulating the gut-brain axis.
results_summary: The synbiotic treatment improved social behaviors, reduced brain inflammation, enhanced gut barrier integrity, altered microbiota composition, and increased beneficial metabolites like butyrate and 3-HB. It also upregulated genes linked to 3-HB synthesis in the colon, liver, and brain.
population_specificity: Male progeny of valproic acid-induced ASD-like mouse model.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a combination of olsalazine-based nanoneedles and inulin gel could restore intestinal homeostasis and alleviate inflammation in inflammatory bowel disease (IBD).
results_summary: The composite of nanoneedles and inulin gel improved gut microbiota diversity, reduced pathogenic bacteria, downregulated pro-inflammatory cytokines, and promoted epithelial barrier repair, significantly alleviating colitis in animal models.
population_specificity: Animal models of IBD (specific species not mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether maternal inulin intervention during pregnancy and lactation confers long-term metabolic benefits to offspring, particularly in lipid metabolism, and to explore the underlying hypothalamic gene methylation mechanisms.
results_summary: Maternal inulin treatment mitigated high-fat diet-induced increases in body weight, adipose tissue weight, and serum insulin and leptin levels while improving serum adiponectin levels in offspring. It also regulated hypothalamic leptin resistance and altered methylation patterns of key genes (Socs3, Npy, Il6, Lepr) involved in the feeding circuit.
population_specificity: Offspring of maternal overnutrition models (induced by excess energy intake before and during pregnancy and lactation).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how inulin affects gut microbiota composition and function in participants with different Bacteroides/Bifidobacterium (Ba/Bi) ratios.
results_summary: Inulin showed metabolic differences between high and low Ba/Bi groups, with the low Ba/Bi group showing increased propionic acid and glycolysis functions, while the high Ba/Bi group was enriched in amino acids and aminoglycolysis functions.
population_specificity: Participants with high and low Bacteroides/Bifidobacterium (Ba/Bi) ratios.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effect of a calorie-restricted diet plus inulin supplementation on serum levels of tryptophan, kynurenine, and the Trp/Kyn ratio in obese women with major depressive disorder.
results_summary: The study found that inulin supplementation combined with a calorie-restricted diet influenced serum levels of tryptophan and kynurenine, though specific outcomes are not detailed in the abstract. The trial was double-blind, placebo-controlled, and randomized, suggesting robust methodology.
population_specificity: Obese women (BMI 30-40 kg/m²) with major depressive disorder.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the effects of inulin on human metabolic health, focusing on its mechanisms of action as a prebiotic.
results_summary: Inulin supplementation was associated with improved metabolic health, including body weight and BMI control, reduced blood glucose levels, enhanced insulin sensitivity, and decreased inflammation markers, primarily by promoting SCFA-producing bacterial species. However, the specific mechanisms of action remain unclear.
population_specificity: Human microbiota (general population, not specified further).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of synbiotic supplementation (including Inulin) on circulating miR-27a, miR-33a, and lipid parameters in patients with dyslipidaemia.
results_summary: The study examined the impact of synbiotic supplementation on miRNA expression and lipid metabolism, but the abstract does not provide specific results regarding Inulin's effects.
population_specificity: Patients with dyslipidaemia (n=56).
effective_dosage: Each synbiotic sachet contained 3 × 10 (units not specified), administered twice a day.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of the gut microbiome in COPD pathogenesis and whether it could be targeted therapeutically.
results_summary: The study found that fecal microbiota transfer (FMT) alleviated COPD features, gastrointestinal pathology, and systemic immune changes, with protective effects additive to smoking cessation. Transfer of smoke-associated microbiota increased lung inflammation while suppressing colonic immunity.
population_specificity: Not specified (likely animal model based on abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of multi-species synbiotic supplementation (including Inulin) on serum IL-10 and fecal SCFAs in patients with dyslipidemia.
results_summary: Synbiotic supplementation significantly increased serum IL-10 and fecal SCFAs (acetate, butyrate, propionate, and valerate) in adult men with dyslipidemia, indicating improved inflammation and gut microbiota regulation.
population_specificity: Adult men with dyslipidemia
effective_dosage: Each synbiotic sachet contained 6 species of probiotic microorganisms with a total dose of 3 × 10^X CFU (exact value not specified in abstract), taken twice daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review inulin's multifunctional applications in drug delivery, prebiotics, and therapeutics, including its anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, and immunomodulatory properties.
results_summary: The study highlights inulin's versatile roles in healthcare, including its biocompatibility, controlled release behavior, and therapeutic potential for chronic diseases, autoimmune disorders, and gastrointestinal ailments. It also emphasizes its FDA approval as a nutritional supplement for infants.
population_specificity: Broad applications, including infants (as a dietary supplement) and potential use for chronic disease patients.
